Docs.param: A object that provides the data for the block.
An optional hash value used to ensure transactional integrity for the block. May be null or an empty string.
An object that represents the condition that must be met in order for the request to proceed. If null, no condition is used.

Docs.summary: Commits a new block of data to the end of the blob.
Docs.returns: The offset at which the block was appended.
Docs.remarks: Clients may send the Content-MD5 header for a given Append Block operation as a means to ensure transactional integrity over the wire. The parameter permits clients who already have access to a pre-computed MD5 value for a given byte range to provide it. If the property is set to true and the parameter is set to null, then the client library will calculate the MD5 value internally.

If you have a single-writer scenario, see to determine whether setting this flag to true is acceptable for your scenario.
